English (United States)(en-US): I met a man today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 어떤 남자를 만났어.

English (United States)(en-US): But there was something\nstrange about him.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 이상하지.

English (United States)(en-US): The moment I looked into\nhis eyes, I was sucked into them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 동공 속을 들여다본 순간, 나는 그\n속으로 빨려 들어가는 것 같았거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Because they were so beautiful?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈동자가 아름다워서?

English (United States)(en-US): No, not like that. It was as if his own world,\nhis own story was unfolding within his eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그런 건 아니었어. 현실을 벗어나,\n그만의 세상 속 이야기가 펼쳐진 것 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): (What...? Can Dot read\nminds or something?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어...? 그게 뭐지? 초능력 같은 건가?)

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think it was a dream?|Do you think it was a memory?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈을 보고 온 걸까?|기억을 보고 온 걸까?

English (United States)(en-US): A dream. It was his dream.\nI could tell, instinctively.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈. 그건 그의 꿈이었을 거야.\n본능적으로 알 수 있었거든.

English (United States)(en-US): It was glorious, experiencing an actual\nfinished dream that had become one with a human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 완성되어 비로소 인간과 하나된 꿈을\n경험하고 오는 건 영광스러웠지만...

English (United States)(en-US): But sadly, his dream was\nmore of a nightmare.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 슬프게도 그의 꿈은 악몽에 더 가까운 존재였지.

English (United States)(en-US): Someone who speaks gibberish\ninstead of saying ‘I love you.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑해 대신 외계어만 나오는 사람이라니.

English (United States)(en-US): My lover not being able\nto say ‘I love you’ to me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 연인이 나에게 평생 사랑한다는\n말을 해 주지 않는다....

English (United States)(en-US): I would feel a little lonely too.|I don’t think I would mind that much.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 역시 조금은 외로울 것 같아.|사실 난 아무렴 상관없을 것 같네.

English (United States)(en-US): Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): Is ‘I love you’ that special?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑해’가 그렇게 대단한 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s probably an important phrase\nfor most humans...including me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 포함한... 대부분의 인간에겐\n아주 중요한 문장일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): There are more valuable things in\nlove than a superficial ‘I love you’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑해’라는 피상적인 말보다\n중요한 것들은 많으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): But I can understand where they’re\ncoming from. Those who feel lonely, I mean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 외로움을 느끼는 사람들을\n이해하지 못하는 건 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>’s understanding mind.\nSympathy. It’s a freeing view.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>의 너른 이해심.\n포용력. 자유로운 시선.

English (United States)(en-US): (This is embarrassing. Laugh and brush it off.)|I mean, I am the most understanding person I know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (부끄럽다. 웃음으로 넘긴다.)|나만큼 이해심 깊은 사람도 없어, 하하.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s probably an important\nphrase for most people.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대부분의 인간에겐 아주 중요한 문장일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘I love you’ is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑해’는...

English (United States)(en-US): the essence of romance, the evidence of love.|the most transparent way to express love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 낭만의 결정체, 사랑의 증표거든.|사랑을 표현하는 가장 투명한 수단이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I love you. I love you. No other phrase\ncould better represent the feeling of love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑해. 사랑해. 이보다 사랑의 마음을\n잘 상징할 수 있는 문장은 없으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Then... then what is ‘love?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼... 그렇다면 ‘사랑’이란 건 뭔데?

English (United States)(en-US): Love is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑은...

English (United States)(en-US): You want to know about\nlove between lovers, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 뭉치는 연인 간의\n사랑이 궁금한 것 맞지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, what was shared between the\nman I saw today and his lovers!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 내가 오늘 보고 온 남자와\n그의 연인들이 공유하던 그것!

English (United States)(en-US): I think most people treat ‘love’ as a force\nthat makes its receiver very special and singular.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대부분의 인간에게 ‘사랑’은 타인을 특별하고\n유일하게 여기게 만드는 힘인 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Personally, I think love is...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보다 개인적인 정의를 하자면, 나에게 사랑은...

English (United States)(en-US): So if that love is unrequited,\nwouldn’t it be lonely and sad?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 한쪽만 상대를 사랑한다면\n그건 외롭고 슬프겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes, yes. It would be devastating.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응, 응응, 응 응. 사무칠 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Like the gloomy taste of\ndark afternoon clouds...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먹구름을 솜사탕같이 뜯어\n먹어야만 하던 오후처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Like the lonely orbit of the Moon,\ndevoted to its planet so blue.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지구를 홀로 사랑하며 공전하는 달처럼....

English (United States)(en-US): Every day would be grey.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매일이 회빛일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): (The lonely orbit of the Moon....)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (지구를 홀로 사랑하는 달이라....)

English (United States)(en-US): (A romantic thought.)|(An interesting perspective.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (낭만적인 상상이네.)|(흥미로운 관점이네.)

English (United States)(en-US): Anyway, the moment you\nhear or say ‘I love you,’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 하지만 애인과 사랑한다는\n말을 주고받는 순간에는

English (United States)(en-US): you can confirm that you are sharing\nsimilar levels of affection with each other.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 서로가 비슷한 층위의 애정을 느끼며\n교류하고 있다는 확신을 가질 수 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): That confirmation will become the\nfoundation for love to grow from.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 확신은 단단한 기반이 되어 주겠지,\n사랑이 발돋움할 수 있도록.

English (United States)(en-US): Right.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Confirm. Confirmation. Con-fir-ma-tion.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 확신. 확 신.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘I love you’ is a device of confirmation!\nA resonating feeling that we are alike,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑해’는 확신!의 장치구나.\n우리가 같다는 공명의 감각,

English (United States)(en-US): a reassurance that I’m not\nalone in this fragile act of love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 애달픈 홀로사랑의 행위를\n하고 있지 않구나! 하는 안심.

English (United States)(en-US): That gentle settling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 느릿한 내려앉음.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe I can understand why those humans\nleft the man, and why he, too, left his lover.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑한단 말을 듣지 못해 서로를 떠났던\n연인들의 마음이... 조금은 이해가 가.

English (United States)(en-US): They were left hovering in\nthe air, unsure and anxious.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들은 허공에 붕 뜬 채로 불안했던 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Then how does it feel to love someone, to\nlike someone the most in the entire world?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 사랑한다는 건, 누군가 세상\n에서 제일 좋다는 건 어떤 감각이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Snug and safe.|Fantastic and intense.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아늑하고 안전한 감각이지.|환상적이고 강렬한 감각이지.

English (United States)(en-US): Like cotton-ball clouds, pillow\nforts, or perhaps a warm hug?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉게구름, 이불 속, 어쩌면 따뜻한 포옹 같은?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s hard to believe such a cozy emotion\nexists, that all humans feel that way!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게나 안락한 감정이 실존한다니. 모든\n인간이 그런 것들을 감각하며 살고 있다니!

English (United States)(en-US): They were right. Humans\nare truly amazing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들의 말이 맞았어.\n인간들은 정말 멋진 존재야.

English (United States)(en-US): Like fireworks, a hot summer night,\nperhaps even a searing kiss!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 불꽃놀이, 열대야, 어쩌면 뜨거운 키스 같은!

English (United States)(en-US): It’s hard to believe such a powerful\nemotion exists, that all humans feel that way!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게나 강렬한 감정이 실존한다니. 모든\n인간이 그런 것들을 감각하며 살고 있다니!

English (United States)(en-US): They were right. Humans\nare truly amazing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그들의 말이 맞았어.\n인간들은 정말 멋진 존재야.

English (United States)(en-US): Uh, well, no—No.\nThat’s just how I define love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 음, 아니- 아니. 그저\n내가 정의하는 사랑일 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Each person may define it differently,\nor be unable to define it at all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사람마다 정의가 다를 수도, 정의란\n걸 아예 내리지 못했을 수도 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): The shape of love can even\nchange every day, every second.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃기지만 매일, 매순간 모양이\n변하는 게 사랑이기도 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Love is... Complex.\nSubtle. Enigmatic.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑은... 복잡미묘하고 어렵거든.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Hm. For example,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음. 가령,

English (United States)(en-US): Emotions fraught with desperate tears|Emotions distorted with obsession|Emotions filled only with comfort but no thrill|don’t seem like love to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 처절한 눈물로 점철된|집착으로 뒤틀려 있는|설렘 없이 편하기만 한|감정들을 나는 사랑이 아니라 생각하지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but some consider them\nto be a part of love as well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그것 또한 사랑의 일부라 여기는 사람도 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Their ‘I love you’ would mean\ndifferently to my ‘I love you.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 사람들의 “사랑해”는 나의 “사랑해”와\n조금 다른 의미를 가질 수 있겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Even within a single relationship,\nlove transforms bit by bit every day!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 한 사람과의 연애에서도,\n사랑은 매일 자잘하게 달라져!

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes a very colorful\nand complex love pops out,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 다채롭고 복잡한 사랑이\n튀어나올 때도 있고,

English (United States)(en-US): and sometimes a quiet\nand still love lingers.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보다 조용하고 정적인 사랑이\n머무를 때도 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): If so, even if it comes from the same\nperson’s brain and the same person’s mouth,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 때는 한 사람의 뇌,\n하나의 입에서 나왔을지라도,

English (United States)(en-US): wouldn’t yesterday’s ‘I love you’ mean\nsomething different from today’s?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어제의 “사랑해”와 오늘의 “사랑해”가\n다른 의미를 가지게 되지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Exactly! You’re quick.|Exactly. It’s mutable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 정확해! 뭉치 똑똑하다.|응, 정확해. 유동적인 거지.

English (United States)(en-US): So, so... ‘Love’ is kind and sweet,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 음, 그러니까... ‘사랑’은\n엄청 다정하고 달콤한 것,

English (United States)(en-US): but can be like a coarse field,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러나 거친 황야 같기도 하고,

English (United States)(en-US): or like a bored sea lion,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지루한 바다 사자 같기도 하고,

English (United States)(en-US): or a little round cherry tomato...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 동그란 방울토마토 같기도 한....

English (United States)(en-US): And ‘I love you’ is a single box that\nhouses allll those feelings, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑해는 그 모오든 결의 마음을\n담아 두는 단일한 상자인 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): That’s one way to put it.|That’s a strange way to put it, but yes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 표현할 수도 있겠네.|그, 그렇게 표현하니까 낯선데.

English (United States)(en-US): But... <nickname>. It’s vague.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데... <nickname>. 모호해.

English (United States)(en-US): To me, ‘I love you’ feels like\nan inconsiderate homonym.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ’사랑해’가 나에겐 친절하지\n않은 다의어처럼 느껴져.

English (United States)(en-US): If no one truly knows what ‘love’ is, if\neveryone perceives the meaning of it differently...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑’이 무엇인지를 그 누구도 정확히 알 수\n없다면. 모두가 다른 뜻으로 사랑을 인식한다면....

English (United States)(en-US): What happens to the emotion put\ninside the box of ‘I love you?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘사랑한다’는 상자 속에 집어넣은\n마음은 어떻게 되는 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): It seems like we’re losing sight\nof what’s really important...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 가장 중요한 무언가를\n놓치고 있는 기분이야....

English (United States)(en-US): Just like the man I met today did.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 만난 그 인간이 그러했듯이.

English (United States)(en-US): Well...
But it seems to be a significant\nphrase for humans...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그치만 인간들에겐 소중한\n단어라고 하니까....

English (United States)(en-US): Can we talk about it later, after\nI’ve pondered over it for a while?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 생각을 마치고 잠시 뒤에\n다시 이야기해도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): Sure. I’ll be waiting here!|Yes, take your time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 기다릴게!|그럼, 천천히 생각해.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, while reflecting,\nI read ten love stories
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 사색의 시간\n동안 ‘로맨스 소설’ 열 권과

English (United States)(en-US): and watched two romance\nfilms. And I realized.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 사랑 영화 두 편을 감상하며 깨달은 사실이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans love...... love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은...... 사랑을 사랑해.

English (United States)(en-US): Not knowing what it is\nbut certain of its existence,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 당최 무엇인지도 모르겠지만 분명히 존재한다는\n‘사랑’을 올려다보며, 그 모양을 가늠하며,

English (United States)(en-US): humans try to guess the shape of\nlove and strive to scratch its surface.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 표면에라도 가닿으려 애쓰는 존재들.

English (United States)(en-US): Such a romantic interpretation of human desperation.|Loving love! Such kind words...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 처절함에 대한 낭만적 해석이네.|사랑을 사랑한다니, 다정한 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): And when they encounter a fragment\nthat resembles love even a little bit,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 사랑을 조금이라도 닮아\n있는 듯한 어느 파편을 마주할 때

English (United States)(en-US): humans speak of love.\nLike chanting a spell.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 사랑한단 말을 하는 거야. 의식처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): Hoping and praying that this fragment\nis, that this time it’s ‘real’ love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 마주한 이 파편은\n‘진짜’ 사랑이길 갈망하면서.

English (United States)(en-US): The man and his lovers probably had\nthat romantic yet innocent intention.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 남자와 그의 연인들은... 아마도 그런\n낭만적이고도 순수한 마음이었을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Finally it feels as if the puzzle is finished.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제야 모든 퍼즐이 맞춰진 기분이 들어.

English (United States)(en-US): The romantic fragility of humans...\nIt’s enough to blind my chalk-drawn eyes!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 분필 눈이 멀어 버릴 만큼 연약하고\n아름다운 생물이야, 인간은....

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, you’ve come to appreciate\nour ‘I love you.’ That’s a relief.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 우리의 ‘사랑해’에 대해 긍정적인\n인식을 가지게 되었구나. 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Mm... Yes, I’ve come to understand\nthe romance in the declaration of love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음... 응, 사랑의 선언만이 가진\n낭만이 있음을 이해하게 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): Although my emotions are\n...chillingly horrified by it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 모든 감각들은... 그것에게\n섬뜩한 공포를 느끼고 있지만.

English (United States)(en-US): Horrified?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공포라니?

English (United States)(en-US): ‘I love you’ can also\nbe... a very chilling box.
